text: The 2016 USA Rugby League season was the sixth season of the USA Rugby League National Premiership competition, and its second as the undisputed top-level rugby league competition in the United States. Fourteen teams competed for the National Championship. The season began on Saturday, June 4, and concluded with the Championship Final on Saturday, August 27, in Boston. The Philadelphia Fight won their fourth USARL Championship, defeating the Jacksonville Axemen 42-20. ==Teams== The Connecticut Wildcats folded after the 2015 season, and were replaced by the White Plains Wombats {| class="wikitable" style="width: 99%" |- | style="background:darkblue; text- align:center;" colspan="7"|North Conference |- | style="background:lightblue; text-align:center;" colspan="7"|Northeast Division |- !style="background:white; width:8%" | Colors !style="background:white; width:25%" | Club !style="background:white; width:15%" | City !style="background:white; width:15%" | State !style="background:white; width:21%" | Stadium !style="background:white; width:8%" | Foundation !style="background:white; width:8%" | Joined |- | |Boston Thirteens |Boston | |Nickerson Field |2009 |2011 |- | |Brooklyn Kings |Brooklyn | |Midwood Athletic Complex |2014 |2014 |- | |New York Knights |New York City | |The Castle Pier 40 |2001 |2015 |- |16px |Rhode Island Rebellion |Providence | |Classical High School |2011 |2011 |- | |White Plains Wombats |White Plains | |SUNY Purchase College |2016 |2016 |- | style="background:lightblue; text- align:center;" colspan="7"|Mid-Atlantic Division |- !style="background:white; width:8%" | Colors !style="background:white; width:25%" | Club !style="background:white; width:15%" | City !style="background:white; width:15%" | State !style="background:white; width:21%" | Stadium !style="background:white; width:8%" | Foundation !style="background:white; width:8%" | Joined |- | |Bucks County Sharks |Levittown | |Falls Township Community Park |1998 |2015 |- | |D.C. Garthwaite Stadium |1998 |2011 |} {| class="wikitable" style="width: 99%" |- | style="background:darkred; text-align:center;" colspan="7"|South Conference |- !style="background:white; width:8%" | Colors !style="background:white; width:25%" | Club !style="background:white; width:15%" | City !style="background:white; width:15%" | State !style="background:white; width:21%" | Stadium !style="background:white; width:8%" | Foundation !style="background:white; width:8%" | Joined |- | |Atlanta Rhinos |Atlanta | |Atlanta Silverbacks Park |2014 |2014 |- | |Central Florida Warriors |DeLand | |Spec Martin Stadium |2014 |2014 |- | |Jacksonville Axemen |Jacksonville | |Hodges Stadium |2006 |2011 |- | |Tampa Mayhem |Tampa Bay | |Larry Sanders Field |2014 |2014 |} ==Regular season== Teams in the South Conference played 6 games on a double round-robin schedule. Teams in the North Conference played 8 games, primarily within their own division. A win was worth 2 points, a draw worth 1 point, and a loss worth 0 points. There were no bonus points for number of tries or close losses. {| class="wikitable" |- !Legend |- style="background:#cfc;" |Qualified to Playoffs Round 2 |- style="background:#ccf;" |Qualified to Playoffs Round 1 |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; |- | style="background:lightblue; text-align:center;" colspan="10"|Northeast Division |- ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:200px;"| Team ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| |- style="background:#cfc;" |1||style="text-align:left;"| New York Knights |8||7||0||1||354||142||212||14 |- style="background:#ccf;" |2||style="text- align:left;"| Boston Thirteens |8||5||0||3||336||150||186||10 |- style="background:#ccf;" |3||style="text-align:left;"| Brooklyn Kings |8||4||0||4||290||264||26||8 |- |4||style="text-align:left;"| White Plains Wombats |8||4||0||4||286||312||-26||8 |- |5||style="text-align:left;"|16px Rhode Island Rebellion |8||1||0||7||190||402||-212||2 |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; |- | style="background:lightblue; text- align:center;" colspan="10"|Mid-Atlantic Division |- ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:200px;"| Team ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:30px;"| ! style="width:20px;"| |- style="background:#cfc;" |1||style="text-align:left;"| Philadelphia Fight |8||8||0||0||384||72||312||16 |- style="background:#ccf;" |2||style="text- align:left;"| Delaware Black Foxes |8||5||0||3||390||266||124||10 |- style="background:#ccf;" |3||style="text-align:left;"| Northern Virginia Eagles |8||4||0||4||280||246||34||8 |- |4||style="text-align:left;"| D.C. Slayers | 30-20 | style="text-align:left;"| Bucks County Sharks |30 Jul 2016, 2:00PM |Duke Ellington Field |- style="text-align:center; background:#f5faff;" | style="text-align:left;"| Northern Virginia Eagles |10-16 | style="text- align:left;"| Philadelphia Fight |30 Jul 2016, 4:00PM |Grizzly Sports Complex |- style="text-align:center; background:#f5faff;" | style="text-align:left;"| Tampa Mayhem |34-40 | style="text-align:left;"| Atlanta Rhinos |30 Jul 2016, 5:00PM |Tampa Catholic High School |- style="text-align:center; background:#f5faff;" | style="text-align:left;"| Jacksonville Axemen |48-12 | style="text-align:left;"| Central Florida Warriors |30 Jul 2016, 5:00PM |Hodges Stadium |- style="text-align:center; background:#f5faff;" | style="text-align:left;"|16px Rhode Island Rebellion |0-106 | style="text- align:left;"| Boston Thirteens |30 Jul 2016, 5:00PM |Brown University |- style="text-align:center; background:#f5faff;" | style="text-align:left;"| Delaware Black Foxes |46-16 | style="text-align:left;"|White Plains Wombats |30 Jul 2016, 8:00PM |Eden Park Stadium |} ==Playoffs== In the South Conference, the teams with the best and worst records, and the second- and third-best records, played each other in the South Conference Semi-Finals. The winners met in the South Conference Final. In the North Conference, the teams with the second-and third-best records in each division played each other in the North Conference Division Semi-Finals. The winners played the teams with the best records in their respective divisions in the North Conference Divisional Finals. The Winners of the Divisional Finals played in the North Conference Final. The winners of the Conference Finals met in the Championship Final. ===Round 1=== {| border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; font-size:90%; text-align:center; width:100%;" |- style="background:#c1d8ff;" !
